title: BBC Scotland Referendum Live on Sunday 14 September 2014, as it happened - BBC News
summary: the two referendum campaigns clashed during a bbc debate from stirling .
media bias and further devolution were among the to discussed .
the latest poll of polls puts `` no '' on 51 % and `` yes '' on 49 % .
scotland 's independence referendum takes place on 18 september .
voters will be asked : `` should scotland be an independent country ? `` .

documents.title: bye for now
text: right , that 's all from us at referendum live for today .
we 'll be back at 06:00 tomorrow with all the latest from both sides of the referendum debate as the final few days of campaigning begins .
meanwhile , you can keep up to date with developments and read analysis of all the big issues on the bbc 's
author: Marianne Taylor
BBC Scotland news

documents.title: referendum - get involvedtweet using # bbcindyref
text: k.d .
turner : that last woman summed it up perfectly .
we already are living in a no vote we need a change for the better # bbcindyref # yes
kerr mccoll : all our politicians have failed us .
just spin spin spin # bbcindyref
sean gallagher : pensioners !
pensions paid by the working , independence higher taxation , jobs losses , secure your future vote no # inderef # bbcindyref

documents.title: referendum - your viewstext using 80295
text: scott , edinburgh : the word `` nationalism '' is being taken way out of context .
the snp ( if voted in to a free scotland ) want to open borders .
not narrow them .
elaine smith is correct : british nationalism brings us ukip-like views .
kate mackenzie , leeds : if it 's no on thursday , westminster can hardly claim a great victory having brought the union to this point in the first place .
anonymous : there has been little said about the fairness of government systems .
westminster still uses the archaic first-past-the-post system which is unrepresentative , but will an independent scotland guarantee fairness as part of its constitution ?
will there be transparency ?
can public servants be made to take responsibility for their actions & corruption removed ?
jan , shetland : how is the yes going fund public svs , new passport , tax , benefit , agricultural grants , vehicle offices etc .
there 'll b no vat , norway funds its economy without oil , & shetland nearly went bankrupt by using the capital of the oil fund !

documents.title: your views
text: anon : i just want to say after watching the last debate from stirling , james cook is & has been impartial and fair ! ! !
so refreshing .

documents.title: off air
text: can you believe how quickly that hour passed ?
the bbc 's final referendum debate programme , which came tonight from stirling , has now finished .

documents.title: referendum - get involvedtext using 80295
text: carol , glasgow : i have worked for two american companies who moved their hqs to england , such moves are purely for tax reasons , no jobs followed .
the banks are saying they will do this for legal tax reasons , simply following which legal entity their tax revenues are based , no other reason .
anonymous : no one has asked a member of the no campaign what they see as some of the opportunities of independence .
david strathblane : vote yes , if you do you might regret it , if you do n't you will regret it .

documents.title: challenge for no campaign
text: james cook comes back to the audience member who asked the question .
she says : `` why do n't we have all of the things the no side talks about now ? ''

documents.title: 'leads the world '
text: ms davidson says she wants scotland to be part of a country that `` leads the world '' .
she says she is `` proud of everything we have built together '' and the `` cradle to the grave '' approach of the uk .

documents.title: 'independent country '
text: mr hosie says independence is `` absolutely normal '' and he wants children to grow up in a `` normal independent country '' .

documents.title: concern for children
text: mr alexander says he is seriously concerned about the results of a yes vote for the children of scotland and urges people to vote no .

documents.title: 'better scotland '
text: elaine c smith says for her it is about the children of scotland , and says a `` yes '' vote is the first step to a `` better scotland '' .

documents.title: referendum - your viewstext using 80295
text: andrew , dundee : a yes vote aims to give us 8.5 % of all the good things we enjoy now .
a no vote gives us 100 % of them .

anonymous : referring to ms smith 's point on nationalism - scottish nationalism is not bad , but one that only emphasises being scottish while rejecting british nationalism , hence rejecting a union of both glory and common value for 400 years is , pretty short-sighted .

documents.title: question five
text: as a young mother who is scared and unsure of the consequences of my vote for my child , and their children , what is the one thing you can say to me to give me faith in your campaign ?

documents.title: public services cuts
text: ms davidson says mr hosie 's claims are `` simply not true '' .

according to the institute for fiscal studies there will be £ 6bn of cuts to public services following a `` yes '' vote , she adds ; a point denied by mr hosie , who says the ifs also pointed to a cut to the barnett formula following a `` no '' vote .

documents.title: privatisation 'threat '
text: stewart hosie says the nhs is a big issue in the referendum , and says `` the real threat comes from the privatisation down south and cuts to the block grant '' .

documents.title: referendum - get involvedtweet using # bbcindyref
text: jade paterson : we would n't be getting any extra powers if it was n't for this referendum so why vote no ?
john bremner : regardless of the outcome , we have to come together .
no blaming , no shaming .
patricia oddie : keep it going ruth we need the snp to take responsibility for what they already have control of .

documents.title: 'american levels of tax '
text: mr alexander says labour lifted hundreds of thousands of children and pensioners out of poverty during their 13-year term in power .
he adds that it 's not possible to have `` scandinavian levels of public services and american levels of tax '' .

documents.title: nhs cuts
text: ms davidson says the snp has cut nhs funding by 1.2 % .

documents.title: referendum - your viewstext using 80295
text: anonymous : can mr hosie provide two numbers ?
how much would scotland 's income be ?
how much will it cost to run the country ?
is there surplus or deficit ?
david , glasgow : `` i would like to see '' why not we will do .
because in the uk they ca n't , we get rhetoric and promises that all too rarely come to fruition .
the only way to make a difference and not just hear about pipe dreams , is to vote yes .

documents.title: written constitution
text: ms smith says a written constitution will enshrine the right to a free health service .
she says voting yes is `` the start of creating a fairer society '' .
she blames westminster for the `` current politics of grievance '' .

documents.title: trident costs
text: mr hosie counters that not paying for trident will go a fair way to making scotland a fairer society .

documents.title: tax on bankers
text: mr alexander , perhaps unsurprisingly , urges a no vote , and says he wants to see measures such as tax on bankers .

documents.title: question four
text: i want a fairer society : should i vote `` yes '' or `` no '' ?

documents.title: 'unlikely bedfellows '
text: ruth davidson stresses that `` there have been unlikely bedfellows on all sides '' .

documents.title: nationalism poser
text: ms smith counters by asking why `` british nationalism is good and scottish nationalism is bad ? ''

documents.title: 'dog whistle journalism '
text: mr alexander attacks the `` dog whistle journalism '' of the snp .
he says the party will want to be able to blame `` london-based newspapers '' for a `` no '' vote in the referendum .

documents.title: referendum - get involvedtext using 80295
text: anonymous : why do we still talk about a currency union when the highest authority on it , mark carney said it is incompatible ?
anonymous : i hope the undecided take their time out and do research instead of listening to the no campaign .
scotland will be better off .

documents.title: 'metropolitan sneering '
text: mr hosie points to the `` metropolitan sneering '' of many london-based journalists , and claims the bbc 's political editor nick robinson is an example of this .

documents.title: uncertainties of independence
text: ms davidson says she was a journalist herself , and it is up to the press to take whatever line they wish .
she says many of the newspapers and commentators are simply warning about the uncertainties of independence .

documents.title: 'barrage of negativity '
text: ms smith says it has not .
she says it is a `` miracle '' that the campaigns are neck and neck considering the `` barrage of negativity and bias '' .
it has not been a fair and balanced debate , a point reiterated to her by `` many journalists '' , she claims .

documents.title: question three
text: do the panel feel that the media coverage during the run-up to this referendum has been fair and impartial ?

documents.title: 'job warnings '
text: `` how many more companies have to give job warnings '' , asks another .

documents.title: 'have n't thought things through '
text: an audience member attacks better together 's `` back of a fag packet '' offer of further powers for the scottish parliament .
`` in the words of your own advert : you have n't 'thought things through , ' '' he adds .

documents.title: fiscal strategy
text: mr alexander says in such circumstances another country would set scotland 's fiscal strategy .
`` why would you want that ? ''
he asks the audience in stirling and those watching at home .

documents.title: currency union
text: `` would there not be less power for scotland if an independent scotland entered into a currency union with the remainder of the uk , '' asks james cook .

documents.title: referendum - your viewstext using 80295
text: anonymous : if all these financial institutions are experts in the danger of a free scotland , how come they could n't foresee all these banking crisis ' and depressions ?
vaz , loch lomond : people should be less worried about the economics of the situation and more worried about why they ca n't imagine their own fellow countrymen being capable of running scotland .

documents.title: re-balancing power
text: ms smith says she does n't understand why anyone would `` give up the chance to have all of the power to take back some of the power '' .

documents.title: more devolved powers
text: mr alexander adds that further devolution is what `` most of us want '' .

documents.title: devolution is 'a journey '
text: mr alexander says he has always believed in devolution and says it is a `` journey '' .
he adds that he is proud of the further devolution that has already taken place , and the latest package offered by labour , rejecting any suggestion that they have been `` watered down '' .

documents.title: referendum - get involvedtweet using # bbcindyref
text: big flash : surely scottish labour must know a yes will revitalise their party and free them from bowing to westminster labour ?
annedon : remember that the unionist parties kept devomax off the ballot paper because `` people of ruk would have to agree them .
# bbcindyref

documents.title: 'grown up '
text: asked about whether a date for independence can be guaranteed , mr hosie says scotland will be independent by march 2016 .
he says the country is `` grown up enough '' to look after all of its own affairs , and should reject the offer of further powers put forward by the no campaign .
ms davidson says her party 's plans have been available for the public to look at for weeks .
she adds that `` scotland can be a better country without losing the things we like about being in the united kingdom '' .

documents.title: question two
text: if `` better together '' were sincere about more powers , why were they only offered with one week to go ?

documents.title: email received
text: panel chairman james cook confirms that he received the email from the treasury , referred to by the member of the audience , without requesting any information .

documents.title: 'leak from treasury '
text: an audience member says share prices dropped due to a

documents.title: team scotland question
text: when asked by mr hosie whether he would join `` team scotland '' , mr alexander says he does not have to `` prove '' his `` patriotism '' to anyone .

documents.title: referendum - your viewstext using 80295
text: alan hulme , greenock : do we really want boris johnson as next conservative pm in coalition with nigel farage of ukip ?
walter , st andrews : can the snp guarantee their agenda beyond 2016 ?

documents.title: 'day of celebration '
text: mr hosie says there will not be a day of reckoning on thursday , but rather a `` day of celebration and self-confidence for the scottish people '' .

documents.title: currency union
text: actor and independence supporter elaine c smith says many businesses who are `` not afraid '' are not being given a voice .
she adds that any uncertainty could be ended by chancellor george osborne announcing his support for a currency union with an independent scotland .

documents.title: banking concerns
text: leader of the scottish conservatives ruth davidson says jobs will be lost in the banking sector if the country votes `` yes '' .
she says only the `` other side '' want to `` silence voices '' and points to jim sillars 's recent comments about a ``

documents.title: 'no ' offers 'safer change '
text: douglas alexander mp , for better together , says `` facts '' have got in the way of the yes campaign 's rhetoric .
he argues that `` faster , safer , better change '' is being offered by a `` no '' vote on 18 september .

documents.title: 'no jobs will be lost '
text: snp mp stewart hosie insists no jobs or functions will be lost following a `` yes '' vote , and urges people to remain calm .
he says businesses will continue to run in an independent scotland , for their own benefit , and for the benefit of the economy .

documents.title: question one
text: why would multi-national , billion-pound corporations issue public warnings if they do n't mean it ?

documents.title: and we 're off
text: the debate has begun .
you can watch it by clicking on the stream at the top of this page , or live on bbc one scotland .

documents.title: coming up in 10
text: less than 10 minutes to go till our referendum debate from stirling begins .
on the panel tonight is stewart hosie and elaine c smith for yes scotland , and douglas alexander and ruth davidson for better together .

documents.title: yes concert
text: the yes campaign 's pro-independence concert is about to kick-off at edinburgh 's usher hall .
the line-up includes glasgow-based bands franz ferdinand , mogwai and frightened rabbit as well as singer-songwriters amy macdonald , ricky ross and eddie reader .

a statement from mogwai said : `` this is a really exciting time for scotland and it 's great to be part of this event to campaign for # voteyes in such an iconic venue with some top scottish talent .
`` it 's time for the decisions about scotland to be made by the people who care most about scotland - the people of scotland . ''

documents.title: referendum - get involvedtext using 80295
text: james , glasgow : in response to shona glasgow , what currency will this money that you say will be raining be in an independent scotland ?
please do tell ?
collette waterfield , essex : if we stay together , will the rest of the uk get the same benefits that 's scotland do , for example free prescriptions and university places ?
i doubt it .
john irvine : shona in glasgow sums up the yes campaign .
the majority think they will get more money .
from where i know i will be worse off : increased income tax , poll tax and national insurance , that 's the reality and only the start .
has anybody in the snp given us details ?
no , i wonder why ?
i know it would political suicide and they know .
that is john swinney is nowhere to be seen .
anonymous : if there was no poll tax , there would be no devolution .
the indie movement would have stayed on the fringe .
we would not be in this situation .
i thank you maggie , from the bottom of my heart , you have made scotland a nation again .

documents.title: referendum - your viewstext using 80295
text: michael , edinburgh : i am saddened in recent days at the bitterness displayed during the referendum campaign .
i fear that , irrespective of the result - yes or no , this will divide and blight our beautiful country for the rest of my life , even if i live to be 100 .
far more important matters in the world that we should all be focusing our energy on : starving sick children and innocent people being killed .
peace & love scotland .
anonymous : the answer every one is looking for on thursday is : no .
the sensible choice .
shona , glasgow : it will be raining money in an independent scotland : who would n't vote for that ?
chris , hemel hempstead : who is paying for this referendum ?
how much will it have cost in the end that could have been spend on health and education ?
i hope it 's just the scottish footing the bill and not everyone else .

documents.title: queen : 'think very carefully '
text: the queen has spoken briefly to a member of the public about the scottish referendum .

outside a balmoral church this morning , when a wellwisher joked they were not going to mention the referendum , the queen remarked : `` well , i hope people will think very carefully about the future . ''
buckingham palace says the queen maintains a position of constitutional impartiality , with her view being that `` this is a matter for the people of scotland '' .

documents.title: 'no fake support '
text: following allegations on social media that some people taking part in last week 's

documents.title: campbell warns on timing
text: sir menzies says that the pledge to give scotland additional powers would have to be fulfilled `` very quickly '' after a `` no '' result .
failure to do so , with the general election taking place in 2015 , would be like `` committing political suicide in scotland '' , he claims .

documents.title: campbell on more powers
text: sir menzies campbell tells the bbc that in the event of a `` no '' vote , powers will be increased for not only the scottish parliament - but in his view , for wales and northern ireland too .
`` we are embarking on a period of very significant constitutional change , irrespective of the vote on thursday , '' he says .

documents.title: your views
text: louise johnson : i get the eu immigration policy , but am i going to be paying taxes in the uk now to support scots as well , when they decide to have a better life down south ?
if ( when ) things go wrong up in scotland it is not going to be welcomed by the remainder of the uk if we have to start paying for migrating scots .

david francis : is n't it pure , dead brilliant , to see ordinary scottish people just ignore those incoherent , doom-laden , daft ramblings of the establishment and simply say - `` we will decide this , not you ! ! ''
roll on thursday and the inevitable yes vote .
so , so proud of my country right now !

documents.title: sturgeon
text: on facebook ,

documents.title: campbell in edinburgh
text: former lib dem leader sir menzies campbell was among those at a `` no '' rally in edinburgh today .

documents.title: devolution debate date
text: former prime minister gordon brown has announced that a house of commons debate on further devolution for scotland has been set for 16 october .
last week mr brown , a member of the better together campaign ,

documents.title: on scotland 's defence plans
text: retired lieutenant commander colin may , a senior faslane naval intelligence officer , is backing the `` yes '' campaign - and adds that he knows `` many royal navy colleagues who would be delighted to serve in scottish defence forces '' .
he says : `` the defence plans by the scottish government would deliver the necessary capability for scotland and the ability to contribute to nato operations . ''

documents.title: swinney on stiglitz comments
text: reacting to economist

documents.title: children of the devolution
text: twin brothers who were born minutes after scotland voted for devolution in september 1997 are now preparing to vote in the referendum on thursday ,

documents.title: murdoch airs views
text: scottish sun owner rupert murdoch was spotted in a number of locations in scotland yesterday , including aberdeen , glasgow and fife .
the media mogul has long been interested in the referendum debate , and has been

documents.title: get involved
text: bob in london : regarding comments on the eu and the uk having to re-apply for membership , this is total rubbish .
it was the westminster government that signed all treaties with the eu , it was not the regional scottish government or mr salmond .
kris in edinburgh , in response to jenny : i disagree - salmond was clearly being conciliatory and saying the yes movement would reach out to every possible part of scotland after a win for yes .

author: Olympic diver Tom Daley

documents.title: campaigners in edinburgh
text: reporter nick eardley says both `` yes '' and `` no '' campaigners are out on middle meadow walk in edinburgh on the final weekend before scots go to the polls .

documents.title: more from sturgeon
text: ms sturgeon says that the referendum outcome `` wo n't be determined by fear , it will be determined by hope '' .
she adds : `` it wo n't be determined by westminster politicians , by banks or by businesses , it will be determined by all of us , the people of scotland . ''

documents.title: sturgeon : 'biggest opportunity '
text: speaking this afternoon at a women for independence event in glasgow 's southside , deputy first minister nicola sturgeon says : `` in just over three days ' time we have the biggest opportunity any of us will ever have to improve the lives of our families and our communities .
`` this is our one guaranteed opportunity to take scotland 's future into our own hands and more and more of us are saying - let 's do this on thursday . ''

documents.title: lewis voters targeted
text: on the isle of lewis in the outer hebrides , placards for both sides of the referendum debate vie for attention .

documents.title: your viewstext 80295
text: craig scoular in uddingston , in reply to jack sherlock : is jack really saying 16 year olds are too young to vote ?
i was at the bbc debate at the hydro with 8000 16/17 year old voters .
trust me , they are as engaged and as informed as any adult , if not more so .
patronising young people in this way is ignorant .
we do n't say some people are too old to vote do we ?
annie : help !
i 'm proud to be scottish and have never really questioned our place as part of the uk .
i now feel torn and undecided what to vote on thursday .
i have read so much and listened to so much that i 'm now confused as to who i should believe !
in truth my head says no but my heart says yes .
thousand of people currently protesting against alleged bbc bias outside pacific quay studios in glasgow .

author: Andrew Browne, Editor of BBC Reporting Scotland

documents.title: airlink magnate voting 'yes '
text: businessman john mcglynn , who founded airlink car parks , says he will be voting `` yes '' - because the offer of more powers for scotland from the `` no '' side was `` too little too late '' .

describing himself as a `` lifelong conservative '' , he says he had wanted to see a `` devo max '' option on the ballot paper - and that in the absence of that option , he had `` no choice '' but to vote `` yes '' .

documents.title: coming up tonight
text: tune-in at 20:00 for the bbc 's final
panellists douglas alexander and ruth davidson for better together , and elaine c smith and stewart hosie for yes scotland , will take questions from a live studio audience in stirling .
james cook , below , is in the chair .
we 'll be streaming the debate live ( you 'll be able to see it at the top of the page ) with text commentary , and it will also be shown on bbc one scotland .

author: Kitty Raven, events organiser for Better Together,

documents.title: more from sir harry
text: sir harry says uk government policies will `` widen inequality '' , writing : `` the comfortably off are misjudging the future if they think playing it safe is the way to go next week .
`` there is no status quo in our economic future .
the times are changing and the only choice is whether we want to be in control of our future or are we happy to hand it over to people who have shown they care little for the weak and the poor . ''

documents.title: sir harry burns on nhs issue
text: sir harry burns on nhs issue

documents.title: stiglitz : 'little basis for fear-mongering '
text: leading economist joseph stiglitz has said there is
mr stiglitz countered the view of fellow nobel prize-winning economist paul krugman , who recently said in the new york times that scotland would face

in an article published in the sunday herald and the scotsman mr stiglitz said that while there would be risks in the event of a `` yes '' vote , the risks of scotland remaining in the union and the uk leaving the eu would be `` significantly greater '' .

documents.title: lord reid 'misspoke '
text: better together sources have told the press association that lord reid `` misspoke '' when he earlier told an event in edinburgh : `` if you do n't know , genuinely , do n't vote , '' - and that he meant to say : `` if you do n't know , vote 'no ' . ''
at the same event , he said : `` there are a thousand ways to make a protest vote .
gambling with the future of your country and future generations is not the most sensible one of those to choose . ''

documents.title: another author weighs in
text: earlier we highlighted novelist jenny colgan 's piece in the observer , saying she does n't want to be `` a foreigner in my own land '' .
fellow scottish author
`` we need to prepare the ground for our children now and not be afraid , '' she writes .
`` there 's nothing 's stopping us .
we can do it if we want to .
yes .
yes .
yes . ''

documents.title: unanswered questions , says mone
text: entrepreneur

documents.title: get involvedtext 80295
text: michael , greenock : businessmen are not all-knowing paragons of virtue .
they are driven by personal wealth not fairness and the common good .
ordinary working people will benefit from independence .
do n't let the businessmen and bankers influence your vote .
jamie in glasgow : how dare lord dannatt suggest scots are betraying lost soldiers by voting yes ?
that is the most vile negativity an out of touch individual from westminster could apply .
it shows utter disrespect to men and women who are far better than him and he could not be more out of touch .
this is the final straw that pushed me to a yes .
anon : if scotland has to apply to re join the eu then the same argument should apply to the rest of the uk .
their membership is based on whole of the uk - when scotland leaves they will be in the exact same position as scotland and will have to reapply too .
if you are sending your thoughts via text , do n't forget to include your name and town .

documents.title: your emails
text: jenny : alex salmond has just said on the andrew marr programme there are no `` no '' voters just deferred `` yes '' voters .
so , all you `` no '' voters , you all now know what your potential leader thinks of you - just gullible voters waiting to bow to the greater wisdom of the great man .
jack sherlock : i am scottish , proud of it , even if i do not live there , as i am sure thousands of others are .
this election process has been manipulated to try and maximize a `` yes '' vote example is 16 year old too young to vote in an general election .
the `` yes '' voters are walking blindly into an abyss , get more local power fine but to destroy and alienate a proud uk nation of welsh , irish english and scots is madness .

policy holder : salmond effectively told andrew marr the way the currency union would work is by scotland having a veto on what policy directives the westminster parliament could give to the bank of england .
the proposition is utterly preposterous and stark staring bonkers .
the final nail in the currency union coffin will be hammered home friday morning .

documents.title: demo
text: `` yes '' supporters are demonstrating outside the bbc 's pacific quay headquarters in glasgow against perceived bias in the corporation 's coverage of the referendum .

author: Rory Stewart, MP for Penrith and the Border,

here 's alex salmond and alistair darling with the

documents.title: rounded view ?
text: the occupants of this house in edinburgh appear to be hedging their bets , with campaign posters for both campaigns displayed in their window .

documents.title: pollster on 'convergence '
text: strathclyde university 's
yes and no campaigns both say they are sure they 'll win .
@ twitterid says `` one is deluded '' or very much mistaken # sunpolscot

a paltry # yesscotland 'win ' will be divisive in scotland and tragic for the uk .
author: Tim Reid
Political correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: reid on 'tight result '
text: on the same programme , lord reid says it is an `` indisputable fact '' that the result `` looks very close '' and urges against using the referendum as a protest vote .

documents.title: salmond claims 'underdog ' tag
text: a busy day so far for first minister alex salmond , who has also appeared on the bbc sunday politics scotland show .
he says : `` i believe we are the underdogs but the feeling in the streets is towards a decisive 'yes ' vote . ''

author: Mark McDonald, SNP MSP for Aberdeen

documents.title: when will result emerge ?
text: in case you are wondering what time the referendum result will come in following thursday 's vote ,

documents.title: galloway on daily politics
text: more from respect mp george galloway 's interview with the bbc 's sunday politics ( see 11:19 ) , specifically his views on labour in scotland .

the `` pitiful job that has been made of defending a 300-year-old relationship in this island by the scottish labour party leadership , is really terrible for me to behold , even though i 'm no longer one of them .
i do n't know how they are going to get out of this death bed . ''
he added that `` without a doubt the number of labour voters intending to vote 'yes ' is disturbingly high '' .

documents.title: sheridan on result
text: sheridan predicts that it will be a win for `` yes '' - with the vote split 60/40 .
it 's fair to say it 's looking a bit closer than that , according to

documents.title: sheridan hails 'momentum '
text: tommy sheridan tells the bbc 's andrew neil that westminster has `` used and abused '' scotland for `` too long '' .
the socialist politician says there is a momentum growing within the working classes who are going to use their power to `` vote for freedom '' .
he tells sunday politics : `` the 'no ' campaign represents the past - the 'yes ' campaign represents the future . ''

documents.title: more lord dannatt reaction
text: when he was on murnaghan , douglas alexander dismissed the remarks
and nicola sturgeon said the comments , claiming scottish soldiers `` died to keep the uk together '' , bordered on being `` offensive and insulting '' .

documents.title: galloway on daily politics
text: andrew neil , host of the bbc 's sunday politics , asks firebrand respect mp george galloway whether with `` big business , big oil , big banks and the tories all against scottish independence '' , is he on the right side in campaigning for a `` no '' vote ?
yes he is , mr galloway replies , because `` the interests of working people are in staying together '' .
`` separation will cause a race to the bottom in taxation , '' he adds .

documents.title: author weighs in
text: scottish novelist jenny colgan

documents.title: reaction to lord dannatt
text: there is a lot of reaction to
david torrance , alex salmond 's biographer ,
the snp 's kenny macaskill

author: David Wooding, Sun on Sunday political editor

documents.title: lord reid warns on 'gambling '
text: former labour home secretary lord reid is urging voters not to `` gamble '' .

speaking to radio 5 live 's chief political correspondent john pienaar , he says : `` it 's not like a car warranty where you can say , i 've tried this and i 'm afraid it is n't what i thought it was going to be , can we change it ?
so if you do n't know , vote no and for goodness sake do n't gamble . ''

documents.title: alexander on 'risks '
text: labour mp douglas alexander tells murnaghan that a `` no '' vote would bring `` safer , faster , better change '' however , adding that institutions have spoken out this week about what they regard as the `` risks '' of independence .

documents.title: sturgeon on murnaghan show
text: scotland 's deputy first minister nicola sturgeon says she has `` never seen the population of scotland so engaged '' .

she tells the murnaghan programme on sky news there has been a `` flowering of the confidence of people in this country '' - and that they wo n't respond to the `` scare-mongering '' of the `` no '' campaign .
media village in front of holyrood .
empty now but will soon get very busy # indyref

@ twitterid not ling now and things are really balanced on a knife-edge .
author: James Williams, BBC Wales political reporter

documents.title: darling responds to offer
text: let 's just say mr darling did n't jump to accept the job .
but he returns the compliment as he sits alongside mr salmond , telling andrew marr : `` of course we have a very high regard for each other '' .

documents.title: salmond offers darling job
text: there is an unexpected job offer for mr darling at the end of the programme .
mr salmond describes him as a `` first-rate politician '' who is `` welcome to be a member of yes scotland '' .
he adds : `` we need talented people like him . ''

documents.title: darling on the debate
text: and mr darling agrees .
the debate has `` energised people '' and he ca n't go anywhere without people wanting to talk about the issues - including his taxi driver , he says - which `` must be good in the long run '' .

documents.title: salmond and darling discussion
text: the final minutes of the andrew marr show see mr darling and mr salmond in the studio together .
there have been `` idiots '' on both sides says the first minister , but 99.9 % of campaigners have enjoyed `` empowering '' and `` invigorating '' debate .
he says it 's been a `` wonderfully enjoyable experience '' .
# marr is right about scotland now having best & most politically educated population in the world # indyref
@ helenridett false .
other than the ppl actually running better together , the average no voter is not `` politically educated '' .
@ twitterid you make the same mistake mainstream politicians make underestimating the electorate
@ helenridett if it is not a lack of pol ed , why do no voters struggle with even the most basic elements of the debate ?
@ twitterid that 's an insulting generalisation .
every working class person on both sides of debate wants a better scotland # indyref

can only be good for the future # marr

@ twitterid @ twitterid and then there 's alistair darling who seems to know nothing but anger

author: Helen Ridett

documents.title: 'best of both worlds '
text: scotland `` wo n't be bullied into accepting something it does n't want '' , says mr darling .
he claims that a `` no '' would bring `` the best of both worlds '' .

documents.title: independence 'risks '
text: there will be a stronger scottish parliament in the event of a `` no '' vote with jobs safeguarded and a fortified health service , says mr darling , without the `` risks '' that independence brings .

documents.title: alistair darling
text: now it 's the turn of the leader of better together , alistair darling .
he tells andrew marr the referendum is the `` biggest decision we 'll ever take '' and stresses there will be `` no going back '' .
`` i do n't want to see my country subjected to years of uncertainty , '' he adds .

documents.title: queen of scots
text: a `` very , very substantial majority '' of people in scotland would want the queen to remain as head of state in an independent scotland , says mr salmond .
the queen of scots is a `` fantastic title '' and a `` fantastic prospect '' , he adds .
there 'd be a `` sustainibility agreement '' between uk and scot after a yes vote to agree debt and borrowing as part of currency deal # indyef

and would vote against any party who agreed it

salmond ?

no details and no plans .
author: Norman Smith
BBC Assistant Political Editor

documents.title: 'day of victory '
text: mr salmond says there would be `` urgent business '' to deal with following a `` yes '' vote - adding that friday , when the result is expected , would be a `` day of victory '' and that scotland would have `` achieved something astonishing '' .

documents.title: end of the matter ?
text: and what if scotland votes `` no ? `` .
there will not be another referendum for a generation , says mr salmond , perhaps `` in a lifetime '' .

documents.title: alex salmond
text: the bbc 's andrew marr begins by asking alex salmond about the legitimacy of a narrow referendum win .
he says that `` one vote is enough in a referendum '' , but that he is `` aiming to win a substantial majority '' .
with hundreds of thousands who never voted before , how can polls with small samples be sure .
mixed forecasts prove nobody can tell .

documents.title: 'holding up '
text: yes scotland campaigners say private canvassing shows that `` the votes are there for a 'yes ' majority '' - but better together says the `` no '' vote is `` holding up '' , with leader alistair darling adding : `` we will win , be in no doubt about it '' .

text: for all the bbc 's referendum news and analysis , you can visit our

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to our live coverage on the final weekend of campaigning ahead of thursday 's referendum .
we 'll be bringing all the news related to the campaign until 18:00 .
